text: {| |} JS Hiuchi is a Hiuchi class Auxiliary Multi-purpose Support (AMS) ship of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force (JMSDF).Werth, Eric. (2007). The ship was built by Mitsui in Tamano and commissioned into service on 27 March 2002.Global Security, AMS Hiuchi Class, ship list The primary mission of the Hiuchi is to support training exercises of other ships, including shooting practice and torpedo launching practice.Global Security.org, AMS Hiuchi Class ==Service== This ship was one of several in the JMSDF fleet participating in disaster relief after the 2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami.Seawaves, "Warships Supporting Earthquake in Japan" Hiuchi was the first of two JMSDF ships which towed barges of fresh water from Yokosuka to the Fukushima I nuclear accidents. The water was used to replace the seawater being used in cooling efforts at the plant.Schmitt, Joe. "U.S. Navy to Provide 500,000 Gallons of Fresh Water to Fukushima Power Plant," Navy Compass (US). March 25, 2011; retrieved 30 March 2011 ==Notes== ==References== * Werth, Eric. (2007). Naval Institute Guide to Combat Fleets of the World: Their Ships, Aircraft, and Systems. Annapolis: Naval Institute Press. ; ==External links== * JMSDF, AMS-4301 ひうち Hiuchi * Ministry of Defense, Press Conference by the Defense Minister (11:11-11:26 A.M. March 25, 2011) Category:Hiuchi-class support ships Category:2001 ships
title: JS Hiuchi
